subject: Do we need this?
msgSnippet: I am fascinated with the effort to make our life more difficult than already is. When I think of simplifying English, I think of writing Linken for Lincoln,
messageBody: I am fascinated with the effort to make our life more difficult than already is. When I think of simplifying English, I think of writing "Linken" for Lincoln, "Wooster" for Worcester and "si" for see and sea, not to create a complete, foreign and awful alphabet to re-do the whole thing. If we want to play "let's simplify English writing" why not to stick with a simplify Latin-based alphabet. The WHOLE WORLD is using the Latin alphabet to modify their non-latin written languages. Even the chinese are thinking to drop the entire idiogram writing system for a latin-based, easy writing. In the meantime we are making the whole thing more difficult. Good luck.

heir non-latin written languages. Even the chinese are thinking to drop the=
 entire idiogram writing system for a latin-based, easy writing. In the mea=
ntime we are making the whole thing more difficult. Good luck.
